  13  # That Comes To My Mind Are: 
  14  # 
  15  # 1. Add Support For 3-State CheckBoxes (Is That Really Useful?). 
  16  # 
  17  # 2. Try To Implement A More Flicker-Free Background Image In Cases Like

  24  #    Know Where To Start To Do That.

  41   
  42   
  43  """ 
  44  L{HyperTreeList} is a class that mimics the behaviour of `wx.gizmos.TreeListCtrl`, with 
  45  some more functionalities. 
  46   
  47   
  48  Description 
  49  =========== 
  50   
  51  L{HyperTreeList} is a class that mimics the behaviour of `wx.gizmos.TreeListCtrl`, with 
  52  almost the same base functionalities plus some more enhancements. This class does 
  53  not rely on the native control, as it is a full owner-drawn tree-list control. 
  54   
  55  L{HyperTreeList} is somewhat an hybrid between L{CustomTreeCtrl} and `wx.gizmos.TreeListCtrl`. 
  56   
  57  In addition to the standard `wx.gizmos.TreeListCtrl` behaviour this class supports: 
  58   
  59  * CheckBox-type items: checkboxes are easy to handle, just selected or unselected 
  60    state with no particular issues in handling the item's children; 
  61  * Added support for 3-state value checkbox items; 
  62  * RadioButton-type items: since I elected to put radiobuttons in L{CustomTreeCtrl}, I 
  63    needed some way to handle them, that made sense. So, I used the following approach: 
  64     
  65    - All peer-nodes that are radiobuttons will be mutually exclusive. In other words, 
  66      only one of a set of radiobuttons that share a common parent can be checked at 
  67      once. If a radiobutton node becomes checked, then all of its peer radiobuttons 
  68      must be unchecked. 
  69    - If a radiobutton node becomes unchecked, then all of its child nodes will become 
  70      inactive. 
  71   
  72  * Hyperlink-type items: they look like an hyperlink, with the proper mouse cursor on 
  73    hovering; 
  74  * Multiline text items; 
  75  * Enabling/disabling items (together with their plain or grayed out icons); 
  76  * Whatever non-toplevel widget can be attached next to a tree item; 
  77  * Whatever non-toplevel widget can be attached next to a list item; 
  78  * Column headers are fully customizable in terms of icons, colour, font, alignment etc...; 
  79  * Default selection style, gradient (horizontal/vertical) selection style and Windows 
  80    Vista selection style; 
  81  * Customized drag and drop images built on the fly; 
  82  * Setting the L{HyperTreeList} item buttons to a personalized imagelist; 
  83  * Setting the L{HyperTreeList} check/radio item icons to a personalized imagelist; 
  84  * Changing the style of the lines that connect the items (in terms of `wx.Pen` styles); 
  85  * Using an image as a L{HyperTreeList} background (currently only in "tile" mode); 
  86  * Ellipsization of long items when the horizontal space is low, via the ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS`` 
  87    style (`New in version 0.9.3`). 
  88   
  89  And a lot more. Check the demo for an almost complete review of the functionalities. 
  90   
  91   
  92  Base Functionalities 
  93  ==================== 
  94   
  95  L{HyperTreeList} supports all the `wx.gizmos.TreeListCtrl` styles, except: 
  96   
  97  - ``TR_EXTENDED``: supports for this style is on the todo list (Am I sure of this?). 
  98   
  99  Plus it has 3 more styles to handle checkbox-type items: 
 100   
 101  - ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD``: automatically checks/unchecks the item children; 
 102  - ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT``: automatically checks/unchecks the item parent; 
 103  - ``TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD``: automatically toggles the item children. 
 104   
 105  And a style useful to hide the TreeListCtrl header: 
 106   
 107  - ``TR_NO_HEADER``: hides the L{HyperTreeList} header. 
 108   
 109  And a style related to long items (with a lot of text in them), which can be  
 110  ellipsized: 
 111   
 112  - ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS``: ellipsizes long items when the horizontal space for 
 113    L{HyperTreeList} is low (`New in version 0.9.3`). 
 114   
 115   
 116  All the methods available in `wx.gizmos.TreeListCtrl` are also available in L{HyperTreeList}. 
 117   
 118   
 119  Usage 
 120  ===== 
 121   
 122  Usage example:: 
 123   
 124      import wx 
 125      import wx.lib.agw.hypertreelist as HTL 
 126   
 127      class MyFrame(wx.Frame): 
 128   
 129          def __init__(self, parent): 
 130           
 131              wx.Frame.__init__(self, parent, -1, "HyperTreeList Demo") 
 132   
 133              tree_list = HTL.HyperTreeList(self) 
 134               
 135              tree_list.AddColumn("First column") 
 136   
 137              root = tree_list.AddRoot("Root", ct_type=1) 
 138   
 139              parent = tree_list.AppendItem(root, "First child", ct_type=1) 
 140              child = tree_list.AppendItem(parent, "First Grandchild", ct_type=1) 
 141               
 142              tree_list.AppendItem(root, "Second child", ct_type=1) 
 143   
 144   
 145      # our normal wxApp-derived class, as usual 
 146   
 147      app = wx.PySimpleApp() 
 148   
 149      frame = MyFrame(None) 
 150      app.SetTopWindow(frame) 
 151      frame.Show() 
 152   
 153      app.MainLoop() 
 154       
 155   
 156   
 157  Events 
 158  ====== 
 159   
 160  All the events supported by `wx.gizmos.TreeListCtrl` are also available in L{HyperTreeList}, 
 161  with a few exceptions: 
 162   
 163  - ``EVT_TREE_GET_INFO`` (don't know what this means); 
 164  - ``EVT_TREE_SET_INFO`` (don't know what this means); 
 165  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_MIDDLE_CLICK`` (not implemented, but easy to add); 
 166  - ``EVT_TREE_STATE_IMAGE_CLICK`` (no need for that, look at the checking events below). 
 167   
 168  Plus, L{HyperTreeList} supports the events related to the checkbutton-type items: 
 169   
 170  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING``: an item is being checked; 
 171  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED``: an item has been checked. 
 172   
 173  And to hyperlink-type items: 
 174   
 175  - ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_HYPERLINK``: an hyperlink item has been clicked (this event is sent 
 176    after the ``EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGED`` event). 
 177   
 178   
 179  Supported Platforms 
 180  =================== 
 181   
 182  L{HyperTreeList} has been tested on the following platforms: 
 183    * Windows (Windows XP); 
 184   
 185   
 186  Window Styles 
 187  ============= 
 188   
 189  This class supports the following window styles: 
 190   
 191  ============================== =========== ================================================== 
 192  Window Styles                  Hex Value   Description 
 193  ============================== =========== ================================================== 
 194  ``TR_NO_BUTTONS``                      0x0 For convenience to document that no buttons are to be drawn. 
 195  ``TR_SINGLE``                          0x0 For convenience to document that only one item may be selected at a time. Selecting another item causes the current selection, if any, to be deselected. This is the default. 
 196  ``TR_HAS_BUTTONS``                     0x1 Use this style to show + and - buttons to the left of parent items. 
 197  ``TR_NO_LINES``                        0x4 Use this style to hide vertical level connectors. 
 198  ``TR_LINES_AT_ROOT``                   0x8 Use this style to show lines between root nodes. Only applicable if ``TR_HIDE_ROOT`` is set and ``TR_NO_LINES`` is not set. 
 199  ``TR_DEFAULT_STYLE``                   0x9 The set of flags that are closest to the defaults for the native control for a particular toolkit. 
 200  ``TR_TWIST_BUTTONS``                  0x10 Use old Mac-twist style buttons. 
 201  ``TR_MULTIPLE``                       0x20 Use this style to allow a range of items to be selected. If a second range is selected, the current range, if any, is deselected. 
 202  ``TR_EXTENDED``                       0x40 Use this style to allow disjoint items to be selected. (Only partially implemented; may not work in all cases). 
 203  ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT``        0x80 Use this style to cause row heights to be just big enough to fit the content. If not set, all rows use the largest row height. The default is that this flag is unset. 
 204  ``TR_EDIT_LABELS``                   0x200 Use this style if you wish the user to be able to edit labels in the tree control. 
 205  ``TR_ROW_LINES``                     0x400 Use this style to draw a contrasting border between displayed rows. 
 206  ``TR_HIDE_ROOT``                     0x800 Use this style to suppress the display of the root node, effectively causing the first-level nodes to appear as a series of root nodes. 
 207  ``TR_COLUMN_LINES``                 0x1000 Use this style to draw a contrasting border between displayed columns. 
 208  ``TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT``           0x2000 Use this style to have the background colour and the selection highlight extend  over the entire horizontal row of the tree control window. 
 209  ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD``             0x4000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are checked/unchecked as well. 
 210  ``TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD``            0x8000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are toggled accordingly. 
 211  ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT``           0x10000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a child item is checked/unchecked its parent item is checked/unchecked as well. 
 212  ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS``               0x20000 Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) at the same horizontal position. 
 213  ``TR_NO_HEADER``                   0x40000 Use this style to hide the columns header. 
 214  ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS``        0x80000 Flag used to ellipsize long items when the horizontal space for L{HyperTreeList} columns is low. 
 215  ``TR_VIRTUAL``                    0x100000 L{HyperTreeList} will have virtual behaviour. 
 216  ============================== =========== ================================================== 
 217   
 218   
 219  Events Processing 
 220  ================= 
 221   
 222  This class processes the following events: 
 223   
 224  ============================== ================================================== 
 225  Event Name                     Description 
 226  ============================== ================================================== 
 227  ``EVT_LIST_COL_BEGIN_DRAG``    The user started resizing a column - can be vetoed. 
 228  ``EVT_LIST_COL_CLICK``         A column has been left-clicked. 
 229  ``EVT_LIST_COL_DRAGGING``      The divider between columns is being dragged. 
 230  ``EVT_LIST_COL_END_DRAG``      A column has been resized by the user. 
 231  ``EVT_LIST_COL_RIGHT_CLICK``   A column has been right-clicked. 
 232  ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_DRAG``        Begin dragging with the left mouse button. 
 233  ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_LABEL_EDIT``  Begin editing a label. This can be prevented by calling L{TreeEvent.Veto}. 
 234  ``EVT_TREE_BEGIN_RDRAG``       Begin dragging with the right mouse button. 
 235  ``EVT_TREE_DELETE_ITEM``       Delete an item. 
 236  ``EVT_TREE_END_DRAG``          End dragging with the left or right mouse button. 
 237  ``EVT_TREE_END_LABEL_EDIT``    End editing a label. This can be prevented by calling L{TreeEvent.Veto}. 
 238  ``EVT_TREE_GET_INFO``          Request information from the application (not implemented in L{HyperTreeList}). 
 239  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_ACTIVATED``    The item has been activated, i.e. chosen by double clicking it with mouse or from keyboard. 
 240  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKED``      A checkbox or radiobox type item has been checked. 
 241  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_CHECKING``     A checkbox or radiobox type item is being checked. 
 242  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSED``    The item has been collapsed. 
 243  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_COLLAPSING``   The item is being collapsed. This can be prevented by calling L{TreeEvent.Veto}. 
 244  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDED``     The item has been expanded.s 
 245  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_EXPANDING``    The item is being expanded. This can be prevented by calling L{TreeEvent.Veto}. 
 246  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_GETTOOLTIP``   The opportunity to set the item tooltip is being given to the application (call L{TreeEvent.SetToolTip}). 
 247  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_HYPERLINK``    An hyperlink type item has been clicked. 
 248  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_MENU``         The context menu for the selected item has been requested, either by a right click or by using the menu key. 
 249  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_MIDDLE_CLICK`` The user has clicked the item with the middle mouse button (not implemented in L{HyperTreeList}). 
 250  ``EVT_TREE_ITEM_RIGHT_CLICK``  The user has clicked the item with the right mouse button. 
 251  ``EVT_TREE_KEY_DOWN``          A key has been pressed. 
 252  ``EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGED``       Selection has changed. 
 253  ``EVT_TREE_SEL_CHANGING``      Selection is changing. This can be prevented by calling L{TreeEvent.Veto}. 
 254  ``EVT_TREE_SET_INFO``          Information is being supplied to the application (not implemented in L{HyperTreeList}). 
 255  ``EVT_TREE_STATE_IMAGE_CLICK`` The state image has been clicked (not implemented in L{HyperTreeList}). 
 256  ============================== ================================================== 
 257

 368 -def IsBufferingSupported(): 

 369      """ 
 370      Utility function which checks if a platform handles correctly double 
 371      buffering for the header. Currently returns ``False`` for all platforms 
 372      except Windows XP. 
 373      """ 
 374   
 375      if wx.Platform != "__WXMSW__": 
 376          return False 
 377   
 378      if wx.App.GetComCtl32Version() >= 600: 
 379          if wx.GetOsVersion()[1] > 5: 
 380              # Windows Vista 
 381              return False 
 382   
 383          return True 
 384   
 385      return False

1413

1444                          flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMICON 
1445                          column = maincol 
1446                          return self, flags, column 
1447                       
1448                  # check for label hit 
1449                  if ((point.x >= self._text_x) and (point.x <= (self._text_x + self._width))): 
1450                      flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL 
1451                      column = maincol 
1452                      return self, flags, column 
1453                   
1454                  # check for indent hit after button and image hit 
1455                  if point.x < self._x: 
1456                      flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMINDENT 
1457                      column = -1 # considered not belonging to main column

1464                      if ((point.x > (self._text_x + self._width)) and (point.x <= end)):

1466                          column = -1 # considered not belonging to main column 
1467                          return self, flags, column 
1468                   
1469                  # else check for each column except main 
1470                  x = 0 
1471                  for j in xrange(theCtrl.GetColumnCount()): 
1472                      if not header_win.IsColumnShown(j): 
1473                          continue 
1474                      w = header_win.GetColumnWidth(j) 
1475                      if ((j != maincol) and (point.x >= x and point.x < x+w)): 
1476                          flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMCOLUMN 
1477                          column = j 
1478                          return self, flags, column 
1479                       
1480                      x += w 
1481                   
1482                  # no special flag or column found 
1483                  return self, flags, column 
1484   
1485              # if children not expanded, return no item 
1486              if not self.IsExpanded(): 
1487                  return None, flags, wx.NOT_FOUND 
1488           
1489          # in any case evaluate children 
1490          for child in self._children: 
1491              hit, flags, column = child.HitTest(point, theCtrl, flags, column, level+1) 
1492              if hit:

1494

1496          return None, flags, wx.NOT_FOUND

3311           ``TREE_HITTEST_NOWHERE``                       0x4 No item has been hit 
3312           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMBUTTON``                  0x8 On the button associated to an item 
3313           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMICON``                   0x10 On the icon associated to an item 
3314           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMINDENT``                 0x20 On the indent associated to an item 
3315           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLABEL``                  0x40 On the label (string) associated to an item 
3316           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEM``                       0x50 Anywhere on the item 
3317           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMRIGHT``                  0x80 On the right of the label associated to an item 
3318           ``TREE_HITTEST_TOLEFT``                      0x200 On the left of the client area 
3319           ``TREE_HITTEST_TORIGHT``                     0x400 On the right of the client area 
3320           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMUPPERPART``             0x800 On the upper part (first half) of the item 
3321           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMLOWERPART``            0x1000 On the lower part (second half) of the item 
3322           ``TREE_HITTEST_ONITEMCHECKICON``            0x2000 On the check/radio icon, if present 
3323           ================================== =============== ================================= 
3324   
3325          :return: the item (if any, ``None`` otherwise), the `flags` and the column are always 
3326           returned as a tuple. 
3327          """ 
3328   
3329          w, h = self.GetSize() 
3330          column = -1 
3331   
3332          if not isinstance(point, wx.Point): 
3333              point = wx.Point(*point) 
3334   
3335          if point.x < 0: 
3336              flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_TOLEFT 
3337          if point.x > w: 
3338              flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_TORIGHT 
3339          if point.y < 0: 
3340              flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_ABOVE 
3341          if point.y > h: 
3342              flags |= wx.TREE_HITTEST_BELOW 
3343          if flags: 
3344              return None, flags, column 
3345   
3346          if not self._anchor: 
3347              flags = wx.TREE_HITTEST_NOWHERE 
3348              column = -1 
3349              return None, flags, column 
3350

3352          if not hit: 
3353              flags = wx.TREE_HITTEST_NOWHERE 
3354              column = -1 
3355              return None, flags, column

4305           ``TR_SINGLE``                          0x0 For convenience to document that only one item may be selected at a time. Selecting another item causes the current selection, if any, to be deselected. This is the default. 
4306           ``TR_HAS_BUTTONS``                     0x1 Use this style to show + and - buttons to the left of parent items. 
4307           ``TR_NO_LINES``                        0x4 Use this style to hide vertical level connectors. 
4308           ``TR_LINES_AT_ROOT``                   0x8 Use this style to show lines between root nodes. Only applicable if ``TR_HIDE_ROOT`` is set and ``TR_NO_LINES`` is not set. 
4309           ``TR_DEFAULT_STYLE``                   0x9 The set of flags that are closest to the defaults for the native control for a particular toolkit. 
4310           ``TR_TWIST_BUTTONS``                  0x10 Use old Mac-twist style buttons. 
4311           ``TR_MULTIPLE``                       0x20 Use this style to allow a range of items to be selected. If a second range is selected, the current range, if any, is deselected. 
4312           ``TR_EXTENDED``                       0x40 Use this style to allow disjoint items to be selected. (Only partially implemented; may not work in all cases). 
4313           ``TR_HAS_VARIABLE_ROW_HEIGHT``        0x80 Use this style to cause row heights to be just big enough to fit the content. If not set, all rows use the largest row height. The default is that this flag is unset. 
4314           ``TR_EDIT_LABELS``                   0x200 Use this style if you wish the user to be able to edit labels in the tree control. 
4315           ``TR_ROW_LINES``                     0x400 Use this style to draw a contrasting border between displayed rows. 
4316           ``TR_HIDE_ROOT``                     0x800 Use this style to suppress the display of the root node, effectively causing the first-level nodes to appear as a series of root nodes. 
4317           ``TR_COLUMN_LINES``                 0x1000 Use this style to draw a contrasting border between displayed columns. 
4318           ``TR_FULL_ROW_HIGHLIGHT``           0x2000 Use this style to have the background colour and the selection highlight extend  over the entire horizontal row of the tree control window. 
4319           ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_CHILD``             0x4000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are checked/unchecked as well. 
4320           ``TR_AUTO_TOGGLE_CHILD``            0x8000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a parent item is checked/unchecked its children are toggled accordingly. 
4321           ``TR_AUTO_CHECK_PARENT``           0x10000 Only meaningful foe checkbox-type items: when a child item is checked/unchecked its parent item is checked/unchecked as well. 
4322           ``TR_ALIGN_WINDOWS``               0x20000 Flag used to align windows (in items with windows) at the same horizontal position. 
4323           ``TR_NO_HEADER``                   0x40000 Use this style to hide the columns header. 
4324           ``TR_ELLIPSIZE_LONG_ITEMS``        0x80000 Flag used to ellipsize long items when the horizontal space for L{CustomTreeCtrl} is low. 
4325           ``TR_VIRTUAL``                    0x100000 L{HyperTreeList} will have virtual behaviour. 
4326           ============================== =========== ==================================================

4854          a standard control -- which is a much better idea than hard coding specific 
4855          colours or fonts which might look completely out of place on the users system, 
4856          especially if it uses themes. 
4857   
4858          This static method is "overridden'' in many derived classes and so calling, 
4859          for example, `wx.Button.GetClassDefaultAttributes()` will typically return the 
4860          values appropriate for a button which will be normally different from those 
4861          returned by, say, `wx.ListCtrl.GetClassDefaultAttributes()`. 
4862   
4863          :note: The `wx.VisualAttributes` structure has at least the fields `font`, 
4864           `colFg` and `colBg`. All of them may be invalid if it was not possible to 
4865           determine the default control appearance or, especially for the background 
4866           colour, if the field doesn't make sense as is the case for `colBg` for the 
4867           controls with themed background. 
4868          """ 
4869   
4870          attr = wx.VisualAttributes() 
4871          attr.colFg = wx.SystemSettings_GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_WINDOWTEXT) 
4872          attr.colBg = wx.SystemSettings_GetColour(wx.SYS_COLOUR_LISTBOX) 
4873          attr.font  = wx.SystemSettings_GetFont(wx.SYS_DEFAULT_GUI_FONT) 
4874          return attr 

4875   
4876      GetClassDefaultAttributes = classmethod(GetClassDefaultAttributes) 

4877
